sentences.en: "How long have you lived here?" — "Twenty odd years."
sentences.cn: “你在这里住多久了？”——“20多年了。”

sentences.en: an odd way to behave
sentences.cn: 古怪的行为

sentences.en: He had various odd cleaning jobs around the place.
sentences.cn: 他在这附近干过各种零碎的保洁工作。

sentences.en: He has now appeared in sixty odd films.
sentences.cn: 他迄今演过60多部影片。

sentences.en: He listened thoughtfully, interjecting only the odd word.
sentences.cn: 他仔细地听着，只是偶尔插句话。

sentences.en: He smiled, an odd, dreamy smile that sent chills up my back.
sentences.cn: 他笑了，笑容古怪迷离，叫我后背发凉。

sentences.en: He was definitely a bit of an odd bod.
sentences.cn: 他这人确实有点怪。

sentences.en: He'd always been odd, but not to this extent.
sentences.cn: 他曾一直很古怪，但没到这种程度。

sentences.en: Her Irish accent, after thirty-odd years in London, is undiluted.
sentences.cn: 她在伦敦呆了30多年，爱尔兰口音仍很浓重。

sentences.en: How many pages was it, 500 odd?
sentences.cn: 这有多少页，500来页？

sentences.en: How odd life was, how unfathomable, how profoundly unjust.
sentences.cn: 生活多么离奇，多么莫测，多么不公啊！

sentences.en: I'm wearing odd socks today by the way.
sentences.cn: 顺便提一下，我今天穿的袜子不成对。

sentences.en: It was an odd thing to say.
sentences.cn: 这话说得很奇怪。

sentences.en: One of the waitresses arrived with a very odd-looking dish.
sentences.cn: 一位女招待端来一道样子相当古怪的菜。

sentences.en: She was holding an extremely odd-looking weapon.
sentences.cn: 她手持一件非常奇特的武器。

sentences.en: Some would call these odd pieces of iron and wood "antiques"
sentences.cn: 有些人会把这些奇怪的铁片与木块称作“古董”。

sentences.en: The odd numbers are on the left as you walk up the street.
sentences.cn: 你沿这条街走时，单号在左边。

sentences.en: There was something odd about him.
sentences.cn: 他这人有些奇怪。

sentences.en: They were an odd couple.
sentences.cn: 他们是奇怪的一对。

sentences.en: They were an odd-looking couple.
sentences.cn: 这对夫妇长相奇特。

sentences.en: They’re an odd couple.
sentences.cn: 他们是古怪的一对。

sentences.en: What an odd coincidence that he should have known your family.
sentences.cn: 他居然认识你的家人，真是太巧了。

sentences.en: What she did was unforgivable, but the odd thing was he didn’t seem to mind.
sentences.cn: 她的所作所为是不可原谅的，但奇怪的是他好像并不在意。

words.tran_cn: 零头；碎屑；零碎物件；奇特的东西

phrases.tran_cn: 出人意料互不相配的一对

trans.tran_en: different from what is normal or expected, especially in a way that you disapprove of or cannot understand
